meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an oligarchy.
meanings.sent1: The oligarchical system limited power to a select few.
meanings.sent2: The country's oligarchical government favored the wealthy elite.
meanings.sent3: In the oligarchical society, only a handful had control over important decisions.
meanings.sent4: The company's oligarchical structure made it difficult for new ideas to flourish.
meanings.sent5: Living under an oligarchical regime meant little say for the common people.

meanings.definition: Ruled by a small group of people.
meanings.sent1: The oligarchical council made all the decisions for the town.
meanings.sent2: The oligarchical leaders held onto power tightly.
meanings.sent3: It was an oligarchical gathering where only a few were invited.
meanings.sent4: The oligarchical control stifled innovation and progress.
meanings.sent5: The oligarchical rule created a sense of exclusivity among the ruling class.
